intro: Colquhounia tenuiflora, commonly known as the narrow-flowered colquhounia, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and rocky areas. Colquhounia tenuiflora is known for its delicate appearance and is often found in conservation areas due to its limited distribution.
